definition: to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
anger/fury/flourishing/vigorous
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)

sentences.english: What you are doing is equivalent to getting angry at the tester for pointing out a fault in your system.
sentences.chinese: 你所做的只是遷怒於文章作者揭露了你體制上的缺點。

sentences.english: Don't resent me, and when you're feeling empty.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在經理生氣時冒犯他，他會遷怒於你。

sentences.english: He visited his anger on his wife.
Fishermen don't let xiao yun out, and turn his rage on this resignation blue winds.
sentences.chinese: 漁夫不讓小云出門，就此辭職，以至遷怒於藍大風。

sentences.english: Don't shoot the messenger, but things will go wrong and you will screw up.
sentences.chinese: 不要遷怒於送信者，事情將出錯，你會搞砸的。

sentences.english: Mike stepped in to stop a fight between two lads and they both turned on him.
sentences.chinese: 麥克插手阻止兩個小夥子打架，結果他倆都遷怒於他。

sentences.english: Will he transfer his anger to the service personnel?
sentences.chinese: 會不會遷怒於客戶服務人員？

sentences.english: I thought it was unfair, and took it out on my father.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這對我不公平，便遷怒於爸爸。

sentences.english: Once the Confucius praised his disciple Yan Hui for "no vent".
sentences.chinese: 孔子曾讚揚弟子顏回“不遷怒”。

definition: to look for trouble
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to bear grudges
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
